TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Settings/Global extends Android.Provider.Settings/NameValueTable

Docs.summary: Global system settings, containing preferences that always apply identically to all defined users.

remarks.para: Global system settings, containing preferences that always apply identically to all defined users. Applications can read these but are not allowed to write; like the "Secure" settings, these are for preferences that the user must explicitly modify through the system UI or specialized APIs for those values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Whether ADB is enabled.

remarks.para: Whether ADB is enabled.

Docs.summary: Whether Airplane Mode is on.

remarks.para: Whether Airplane Mode is on.

Docs.summary: A comma separated list of radios that need to be disabled when airplane mode is on.

remarks.para: A comma separated list of radios that need to be disabled when airplane mode is on. This overrides WIFI_ON and BLUETOOTH_ON, if Wi-Fi and bluetooth are included in the comma separated list.

Docs.summary: If 1, the activity manager will aggressively finish activities and processes as soon as they are no longer needed.

remarks.para: If 1, the activity manager will aggressively finish activities and processes as soon as they are no longer needed. If 0, the normal extended lifetime is used.

Docs.summary: Scaling factor for Animator-based animations.

remarks.para: Scaling factor for Animator-based animations. This affects both the start delay and duration of all such animations. Setting to 0 will cause animations to end immediately. The default value is 1.

Docs.summary: Value to specify if the user prefers the date, time and time zone to be automatically fetched from the network (NITZ). 1=yes, 0=no

remarks.para: Value to specify if the user prefers the date, time and time zone to be automatically fetched from the network (NITZ). 1=yes, 0=no

Docs.summary: Value to specify if the user prefers the time zone to be automatically fetched from the network (NITZ). 1=yes, 0=no

remarks.para: Value to specify if the user prefers the time zone to be automatically fetched from the network (NITZ). 1=yes, 0=no

Docs.summary: Whether bluetooth is enabled/disabled 0=disabled. 1=enabled.

remarks.para: Whether bluetooth is enabled/disabled 0=disabled. 1=enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri ContentUri { get; set; }

Docs.summary: The content:// style URL for global secure settings items.

remarks.para: The content:// style URL for global secure settings items. Not public.

Docs.summary: Whether or not data roaming is enabled. (0 = false, 1 = true)

remarks.para: Whether or not data roaming is enabled. (0 = false, 1 = true)

Docs.summary: Name of an application package to be debugged.

remarks.para: Name of an application package to be debugged.

Docs.summary: Whether user has enabled development settings.

remarks.para: Whether user has enabled development settings.

Docs.summary: Whether the device has been provisioned (0 = false, 1 = true)

remarks.para: Whether the device has been provisioned (0 = false, 1 = true)

MemberSignature.Value: public static float GetFloat (Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name);
.method public static hidebysig float32 GetFloat(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The ContentResolver to access.
The name of the setting to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a float.

remarks.para: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a float. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings; this function converts the string to a float for you.
This version does not take a default value. If the setting has not been set, or the string value is not a number, it throws .

Docs.exception: Thrown if a setting by the given name can't be found or the setting value is not a float.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float GetFloat (Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float def);
.method public static hidebysig float32 GetFloat(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float32 def) cil managed

Docs.param: The ContentResolver to access.
The name of the setting to retrieve.
Value to return if the setting is not defined.
Docs.summary: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a floating point number.

remarks.para: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a floating point number. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings; this function converts the string to an float for you. The default value will be returned if the setting is not defined or not a valid float.

This version does not take a default value. If the setting has not been set, or the string value is not a number, it throws .

Docs.summary: Construct the content URI for a particular name/value pair, useful for monitoring changes with a ContentObserver.

remarks.para: Construct the content URI for a particular name/value pair, useful for monitoring changes with a ContentObserver.

Docs.summary: Host name and port for global http proxy.

remarks.para: Host name and port for global http proxy. Uses ':' seperator for between host and port.

Docs.summary:
Whether the package installer should allow installation of apps downloaded from sources other than Google Play.
1 = allow installing from other sources 0 = only allow installing from Google Play

remarks.para:
Whether the package installer should allow installation of apps downloaded from sources other than Google Play.
1 = allow installing from other sources 0 = only allow installing from Google Play

Docs.summary: Ringer mode.

remarks.para: Ringer mode. This is used internally, changing this value will not change the ringer mode. See AudioManager.

Docs.summary: User preference for which network(s) should be used.

remarks.para: User preference for which network(s) should be used. Only the connectivity service should touch this.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool PutFloat (Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float value);
.method public static hidebysig bool PutFloat(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float32 value) cil managed

Docs.param: The ContentResolver to access.
The name of the setting to modify.
The new value for the setting.
Docs.summary: Convenience function for updating a single settings value as a floating point number.

remarks.para: Convenience function for updating a single settings value as a floating point number. This will either create a new entry in the table if the given name does not exist, or modify the value of the existing row with that name. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings, so this function converts the given value to a string before storing it.

Docs.summary: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Bluetooth radio.

remarks.para: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Bluetooth radio.

Docs.summary: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Cellular radio.

remarks.para: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Cellular radio.

Docs.summary: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify NFC radio.

remarks.para: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify NFC radio.

Docs.summary: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Wi-Fi radio.

remarks.para: Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Wi-Fi radio.

Docs.summary: Control whether the process CPU usage meter should be shown.

remarks.para: Control whether the process CPU usage meter should be shown.

Docs.summary: Whether we keep the device on while the device is plugged in.

remarks.para:
Whether we keep the device on while the device is plugged in. Supported values are:
0 to never stay on while plugged in
to stay on for AC charger
to stay on for USB charger
to stay on for wireless charger These values can be OR-ed together.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Scaling factor for activity transition animations.

remarks.para: Scaling factor for activity transition animations. Setting to 0 will disable window animations.

Docs.summary: USB Mass Storage Enabled

remarks.para: USB Mass Storage Enabled

Docs.summary: If this setting is set (to anything), then all references to Gmail on the device must change to Google Mail.

remarks.para: If this setting is set (to anything), then all references to Gmail on the device must change to Google Mail.

Docs.summary: If 1, when launching DEBUG_APP it will wait for the debugger before starting user code.

remarks.para: If 1, when launching DEBUG_APP it will wait for the debugger before starting user code. If 0, it will run normally.

Docs.summary: The maximum number of times we will retry a connection to an access point for which we have failed in acquiring an IP address from DHCP.

remarks.para: The maximum number of times we will retry a connection to an access point for which we have failed in acquiring an IP address from DHCP. A value of N means that we will make N+1 connection attempts in all.

Docs.summary: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to hold a wakelock while waiting for mobile data connectivity to be established after a disconnect from Wi-Fi.

remarks.para: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to hold a wakelock while waiting for mobile data connectivity to be established after a disconnect from Wi-Fi.

Docs.summary: Whether to notify the user of open networks.

remarks.para: Whether to notify the user of open networks.

If not connected and the scan results have an open network, we will put this notification up. If we attempt to connect to a network or the open network(s) disappear, we remove the notification. When we show the notification, we will not show it again for time.

Docs.summary: Delay (in seconds) before repeating the Wi-Fi networks available notification.

remarks.para: Delay (in seconds) before repeating the Wi-Fi networks available notification. Connecting to a network will reset the timer.

Docs.summary: When the number of open networks exceeds this number, the least-recently-used excess networks will be removed.

remarks.para: When the number of open networks exceeds this number, the least-recently-used excess networks will be removed.

Docs.summary: Whether the Wi-Fi should be on.

remarks.para: Whether the Wi-Fi should be on. Only the Wi-Fi service should touch this.

Docs.summary: The policy for deciding when Wi-Fi should go to sleep (which will in turn switch to using the mobile data as an Internet connection).

remarks.para: The policy for deciding when Wi-Fi should go to sleep (which will in turn switch to using the mobile data as an Internet connection).
Set to one of , , or .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.GlobalWifiSleepPolicy WifiSleepPolicyDefault = (0)

Docs.summary: Value for to use the default Wi-Fi sleep policy, which is to sleep shortly after the turning off according to the setting.

remarks.para: Value for to use the default Wi-Fi sleep policy, which is to sleep shortly after the turning off according to the setting.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.GlobalWifiSleepPolicy enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Value for to never go to sleep.

remarks.para: Value for to never go to sleep.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.GlobalWifiSleepPolicy WifiSleepPolicyNeverWhilePlugged = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.GlobalWifiSleepPolicy enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Value for to use the default policy when the device is on battery, and never go to sleep when the device is plugged in.

remarks.para: Value for to use the default policy when the device is on battery, and never go to sleep when the device is plugged in.

Docs.summary: Whether the Wi-Fi watchdog is enabled.

remarks.para: Whether the Wi-Fi watchdog is enabled.

Docs.summary: Scaling factor for normal window animations.

remarks.para: Scaling factor for normal window animations. Setting to 0 will disable window animations.
